page.title: 06FARMING IN AREA
page.content: June 28th - very wet. At Home Farm third 3OO tonne clamp of silage now complete 2 weeks later than normal. It has been covered with plastic sheeting and held down with old car tyres. The 17O Jersey cows are out at grass, coming to be milked by the 2 herdsmen at 6am and 3 pm. Milking takes just 2 hours through a 1O x 2O herringbone parlour. This year's yield-first 3 months-below quota set by the EEC. The winter wheat - Norman, Fenman, Stetson - and winter barley - Igri look well, bowed by the heavy rain the main danger comes from mildew and yellow rust, which could cause loss of yeild and quality. Prices falling (despite famine in Africa) due to large surplus in EEC and USA. Tonight the National Farmers Union are holding a farm walk here with a supper afterwards.
